III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section Staff to resident ratio
Description (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member has left the hall unattended and does not conduct
required checks on youth. The staff member smokes on the front
porch when they are the only staff on shift.
Investigation The Complainant was anonymous.
Administrator was interviewed via telephone on October 15,
2025, and in person at the facility on October 22, 2025.
Administrator denied being aware of any concerns of Staff 1 not
completing checks on the youth. Administrator stated the nightly
logbooks document variable interval checks of all the youth being
completed on time. Administrator reported Staff 1 works third shift
with another staff member and during Staff 1’s breaks cameras
show Staff 1 getting into his car and leaving the property to
smoke. Administrator denied cameras showing Staff 1 smoking
on the porch or not completing checks on the youth when
Administrator has done spot checks of the cameras.
Administrator reported there has not been anything in the staff
weekly notes, supervisor meetings, daily management meetings
or request to speak by the youth stating Staff 1 is leaving the hall,
not completing checks or smoking on the porch.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
22, 2025. Staff 1 described always having another person
working third shift with him. Staff 1 stated the only time he leaves
the hall is when the other staff member he is working with stays in
the hall to complete the variable checks on the youths. Staff 1
stated the staff member not completing the checks on the youth is
tasked to complete the household chores. Staff 1 reported he
checks in with the other staff working in the hallway and will switch
duties throughout the night. Staff 1 denied ever leaving the hall
unattended and not completing the required checks on the youth.
Staff 1 stated during his breaks he gets into his car and leaves the
property to smoke while the other staff member he is working with
stays with the youth. Staff 1 denied ever smoking on the porch.
Staff 1 described most of his shifts he works with Supervisor or
Staff 3.
2

Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
22, 2025. Staff 2 reported he did not have any concerns with Staff
1. Staff 2 denied hearing any of the youth say Staff 1 was not in
the hallway completing nightly checks.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 22, 2025. Youth A reported two staff work third shift.
Youth A described staff always being in the hall whenever she
wakes up in the night. Youth A denied seeing any staff member
sleeping or not completing checks.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on October 22,
2025. Supervisor described working some shifts with Staff 1.
Supervisor denied having any concerns with Staff 1 leaving the
hall unattended and not conducting the required checks on the
youth. Supervisor stated he is aware Staff 1 smokes and reported
during breaks Staff 1 leaves the property to smoke. Supervisor
reported when reviewing the nightly logbooks Staff 1 has not
missed a variable interval check on the youth. Supervisor stated
he is not aware of Staff 1 doing anything against policy and
procedure while working. Supervisor denied any youth or staff
expressing concerns regarding Staff 1 leaving the hall and not
completing checks.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2025.
Staff 3 reported she saw Staff 1 smoking on the porch during shift
and told Administrator and Supervisor. Staff 3 stated she could
not recall what day this occurred but believed it was within the last
month and on a Sunday. Staff 3 reported when working with Staff
1 he would do the household chores while she stayed in the hall
and completed the checks on the youth.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 9/12/2025 through 10/12/2025 of the hallway,
porch and driveway of third shift was reviewed. Video shows Staff
1 moving throughout the house, completing household chores,
talking with Staff 3, sitting in the hallway, and leaving in a car
during his break. Video did not show the hall left unattended or
Staff 1 smoking on the porch. Video only goes back 30 days.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed supervision of residents training on
10/09/2025.
3

• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 3 completed supervision of residents training on
10/09/2025.
• October Staff Schedule to review dates Staff 1 was
scheduled to work.
• Youth Opportunity River Oak Youth Center Youth
Supervision, Movement and Checks Policy. The policy
documents, “Staff shall ensure the location of all youth, at
all times. The program shall ensure that staff observe youth
at varying intervals at least every ten minutes while they
are in their sleeping rooms, either during sleep, rest periods
or other times youth are in their rooms. Staff observations
shall be completed and documented in real time ensuring
the safety and security of each youth.”
• Youth Opportunity bedtime logs dated 09/12/2025 through
10/12/2025 completed by Staff 1 documented checks were
completed at varying intervals.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per Administrator, Staff 1,
Staff 2, Supervisor and Youth A interviews and video review, Staff
1 did not leave the hall unattended or smoke on the front porch.
Staff interviews and video footage show Staff 1 conducting the
required checks on youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149
Section Youth nutrition
Description (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible meals
daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation This same staff member has been lapsed in making the youth
breakfast at times.
Investigation The Complainant was anonymous.
Administrator was interviewed via telephone on October 15,
2025, and in person at the facility on October 22, 2025.
Administrator reported being aware of a miscommunication
between Staff 1 and Staff 2 regarding who was making breakfast
one morning for the youth. Administrator stated Staff 1 thought he
was being asked if he wanted to make breakfast, not that he
needed to make breakfast. Administrator reported Staff 1 circled
back to Staff 2, the first shift worker, to clear up who needed to
make breakfast the next day on shift. Administrator stated that the
4

youth received breakfast there was just miscommunication as to
who was making breakfast.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
22, 2025. Staff 1 denied being lapse in making breakfast. Staff 1
reported there was miscommunication between Staff 2 and him.
Staff 1 reported he pulled the items for breakfast the night before,
as he always does when working, and Staff 2 asked him if he
wanted to make breakfast. Staff 1 thought Staff 2 was asking him
if he wanted to make breakfast, not telling him he needed to make
breakfast. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 made breakfast for the youth
that morning and later Staff 1 realized he needed to make
breakfast. Staff 1 stated it was not a big deal and they [Staff 1
and Staff 2] just needed to be clearer with their communication.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
22, 2025. Staff 2 reported two weeks ago there was
miscommunication between him and Staff 1 over who was
cooking breakfast. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 thought he was being
asked if he wanted to cook breakfast, not that he needed to cook
breakfast when Staff 2 asked him [Staff 1]. Staff 2 reported the
youth received breakfast and it was not an issue.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 22, 2025. Youth A reported breakfast is always available
in the morning. Youth A stated staff cook breakfast but did not
know if it was a third shift or first shift staff that cook breakfast.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2025.
Staff 3 reported Staff 1 always forgot to cook breakfast for the
youth. Staff 3 stated the youth received breakfast because a
different staff member would have to cook. Staff 3 reported third
shift staff are supposed to cook breakfast.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed new hire training on 5/16/2025.
• Youth Opportunity River Oak Youth Center Employee
Handbook. The handbook documents, “The new
employee’s supervisor will introduce the new employee to
staff throughout the company, review their job description
and requirements of the position, explain the company’s
evaluation procedures, and help the new employee get
started on specific tasks and functions.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews breakfast is being provided to the youth at the facility.
5

Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
